plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: Sunflowers are tall annual plants with large, bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disc that matures into seeds. They are known for their heliotropism, turning to face the sun throughout the day.
plants.bloomingSeason: Mid-summer to early fall (July to September)
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, often cultivated but also naturalized in North America and Europe
plants.funFact: Sunflowers can grow up to 3 meters tall and their seeds are a nutritious food source for both people and wildlife.

plants.name: Rhododendron arboreum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree that produces clusters of bright red, trumpet-shaped flowers. It is the national flower of Nepal and grows in the Himalayan region.
plants.location: Himalayan foothills and mountainous regions in South Asia
plants.funFact: This species can grow over 20 meters tall and its flowers are used in traditional medicines.

plants.name: Echinacea purpurea
plants.description: A hardy perennial native to North America with large, purplish-pink petals surrounding a spiny, orange-brown central cone. Popular for medicinal uses and pollinator gardens.
plants.bloomingSeason: Mid-summer to early fall (July to September)
plants.funFact: Echinacea is widely used in herbal remedies believed to boost the immune system.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: An aquatic perennial with large, fragrant pink or white flowers that float above water on long stems. It holds cultural and religious significance in Asia.
plants.bloomingSeason: Summer to early fall (June to September)
plants.location: Wetlands and ponds across Asia, particularly India and China
plants.funFact: Lotus seeds can remain viable for hundreds of years; one seed germinated after about 1,300 years.
